It is an older property on Hotel Circle, so considering the location, it was quiet, well appointed with comfortable beds, and fully adequate for a group mainly using for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Mamacitadedos
Reviews.Content: Don't expect top quality here. This is a very old motel!!! We stayed in a two room suite, which was nothing more then two adjoining rooms. Kitchen area was not what I expected and it certainly wasn't stocked well. I was shocked they only had two small pans which were only good to cook soup in. The rooms had a terrible smell, I can't even begin to guess what that was. The walls are paper thin! You can hear everything around you and above you! Including the TV's, running kids, etc. The pictures on the website are very misleading. Just remember this is an old motel, nothing special at all!!! There are better places to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jamesoz1
Reviews.Content: as expected from Comfort. Clean,good pool,usual breakfast with continental fare + waffles,hard boiled eggs. Couple small tlc issues but overall well kept. Easy access to interstate,old town.Got a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Like the location - clean room”
Reviews.Author: wubitizer
Reviews.Content: We stay here on 2/19/09. We checked in very late (around 11pm) and the process was very quick. Surprisingly, we have a family suite with two bunk-beds for our two kids. Although it is not a true family suite with separate kids area, the kids are excited to have their own bunk bed. The room is small but clean with one queen bed and two bunkbeds but the full kitchen is very nice (although we did not use it). The free breakfast was pretty good with read-to-made waffle that my kids loved. Overall, we are pretty happy since we booked it at last minute for under $100. It's so close to Seaworld, the front desk hold our luggae whole day whiel we were in Sea World. We also ate at the Ricky's Dinner and it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ksujeo
Reviews.Content: Very, very small room. Bed was comfortable, but that was the only + to this place. With many other motels in the area, would definitely recommend picking a different one. Breakfast area was so busy and messy, we choose to go to a nearby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: CraigAWashDC
Reviews.Content: My room was comfortable and clean. It smelled a bit funny - I could not figure out why. The internet worked fine - I was able to do a lot of work between meetings. It is located just down the hill from a great taco restaurant near UCSD Hospital. It was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh...”
Reviews.Author: mathrocckrules
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything great about this place. The best thing I can say is that the staff was friendly. There were teenagers knocking on room doors, asking for money, even though our do not disturb sign was on the door. We spoke to family members also staying in this motel and they were also asked for money. We had 10-12 menus pushed through our door at all hours of the night and morning. Very thin walls, could even hear cell phones ringing at 5:00am in the room next to us. Very hard to rest here. My boyfriend took a bite of his cereal in the breakfast room and then immediately had to spit it out because the milk was sour! And our deadlock bolt was missing 3 out of 4 screws.. Very strange place, will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: bountifulutetraveler
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after canceling the remaining 2 nights of a 3-night stay at the terrible Days Inn Harbor View in downtown San Diego. The minute we walked into the Comfort Inn, they took care of us. We were given a good rate, they allowed us to look at the room before booking it, and we had a new, quality room in no time! So many pros: 1. A great breakfast. Cereals, good juices, waffles, fresh fruit, hot chocolate, hard boiled eggs, bagels, fresh danishes, muffins, and more. It was served in a spacious breakfast room. 2. Pool area. It was a large, clean pool. They had a nice hot tub as well. 3. Quiet. It's near the freeway, but off it just enough for it to be pleasant. 4. Beds. Very comfortable. Serta mattresses. 5. Spacious room. We had plenty of space in the room, and it has lots of counter space for the bathroom sink. Not many cons. It's a little further away from Downtown, but it's just a quick 10 minute drive to the heart of the city. We really liked the Comfort Inn, and we will certainly return here next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: artandkelly
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. We had a kids suite that had a separate room w/bunk beds, tv and ac for the kids. It was big enough and so close to Seaworld. The personel were great. It's in a great area of San Diego. We felt safe and very comfortable. The fridge could have been bigger but we had one. If you would like alone time w/your spouse while on a family vacation, this is the room for you. I can't recommend it enough. We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTE, GREAT ROOM, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: janaeprice
Reviews.Content: We loved it, we walked in because we canceled our other hotel at the last min. and they got us in within 5 mins. And it was wonderful. Nice pool great breakfast great customer service,. We stayed here for 3 nights and the bed was wonderful. We are staying here again in a couple of months. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “30 Usd Incidentals Mistake”
Reviews.Author: miniLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a motor Inn, close to San Diego. It's not worthy the 150 USD we paid. Sleep and go. That was yesterday. Today, by mere chance, we happened to check the American Express charges and we discovered a 30 USD charge. Through calling hotels.com we know that the charge is for "incidentals" and that it has been a "mistake". We were not notified of the charge at the check-out and we actually requested the "approval for incidentals paper" to be given back to us or destroyed in front of us. Now they say it has been a mistake and that they are going to credit the money back, but one has the bad feeling... If the "mistake" goes unnoticed, it is easy money.

Reviews.Title: “Game room, exercise room, high speed, NOT”
Reviews.Author: dslspeed
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not have a game room anymore, exercise room under renovation, pool closed , jacuzzi closed also, they were fixing a fence and trying to get the pool chemicals back up to the right levels. It was nice listening to the jackhammer at 7:30 am. The high speed internet is does not work most of the time. We had 8% connectivity. The deluxe continental breakfast was okay, but everything was the cheapest grade of food they could get. The sink is in the sleeping quarters. All of this along with the elephant trouncing around upstairs we ended up going to the pacific terrace hotel at $50 less a night. What a difference. Huge room, excellent view, right on ocean, great free breakfast, NICE. You decide.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some serious work.”
Reviews.Author: tconk40554Vegas
Reviews.Content: Room smelled of mold. Wireless internet didn't work. Ran out of hot water and had to take a cold shower. The staff was friendly enough but they have an old wreck of a hotel to manage and I will not stay there again unless they do some serious renovations. I can accept that a budget hotel is not the Ritz but it can surely be clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Bad in every sense.”
Reviews.Author: travelhelperus
Reviews.Content: Our bathroom was NEVER clean, it usually smelled of urine. The filth, hairs and dirt behind the bathroom door were there when we arrived and stayed there when we left, a week later. Breakfast had nothing to do with the colorful picture they have at the entrance. Our TV didn't work properly and we had to watch pay movies with continuos interruptions of other channels (after alot of arguing, we managed not to get charged for them). Internet never seemed to work correctly, we had to keep logging in or restarting our computer. As soon as our week was through we moved to another hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “There have to be better places!”
Reviews.Author: MarianReader
Reviews.Content: We chose this Comfort Inn because of a recommendation on the CA forum, but we were disappointed. We are Comfort Inn loyalty program members, but unlike HIEX or Fairfield Inn, etc, that doesn't mean anything when you check in or out - you still have to wait in line, and wait for your bill at check out. I did not realize the motel had exterior doors (seem less safe). Maid service was okay but little things were ignored - no fresh bag for ice bucket, no new coffee for coffeemaker, etc. Breakfast was okay. Biggest plus was Ricky's, the very nice, friendly, affordable restaurant on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a Little more for better place”
Reviews.Author: juliewillgreg
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel while hitting all of the San Diego sites - Sea Wolrd, Zoo and Wild Animal Park, along with Cabrillo National Park and Point Loma, Old Town, etc. There were tons of hotels on hotel circle and had I known I would have searched for another. The good things were that the location could not be beat. It was extremely convenient to Sea World, 1.5 m to Old Town with no interstate, close to Cabrillo and convenient to Zoo and Balboa Park. The other good thing is that breakfast is included - though not the greatest unless you like all bread -bagels, toast, muffins, waffles, cereal. No change. The room itself is no where near as big as it looks onthe web. There was no extra room for luggage, stretching out. The outlets in the hotel were all loose and your plugged in appliances would fall out. The lightbulbs were not all working - which should be easily enough solved, but was not. The shower curtin barely met the top of the tub so everytime youshowered you got water onthe floor. It was not the cleanest . I am picky, but I do not accept burn holes in bedding in any room and certainly not non-smoking rooms. Overall it was adequate and some nights were a value, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but not the best either”
Reviews.Author: heretodaygonetomorrow
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a Comfort Inn before you will get pretty much what you expect. We booked a room with bunk beds for the kids -a little cramped, but you're only there to sleep. Having the kitchenette was nice but we had to use the bathroom towels to dry the dishes - no dishtowels. Laundry facilities were excellent and the breakfast, while busy, was good enough. Ricky's Restaurant next door offered good food at reasonable prices. On the downside, the pool area needed to be better lit than it was and if you are on the ground floor, be prepared for noise from the room above you. Overall, a good deal for those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “TV broken.”
Reviews.Author: Donricodelavega
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with the room. It was basic but comfortable. The biggest problem was the TV. It had an issue where it would not switch to regular channels and instead just kept playing the "pay per view" options over and over. And the kicker, is the damn TV wouldn't turn off. Neither the remote or the button on the TV itself wouldn't turn the TV off. So we were stuck listening to commercials for sometimes up to 20 minutes before one of the buttons would finally work to turn it off. I called the front desk to ask for assistance. They said they would send someone but 20 minutes later no one had shown up. By then the TV started acting properly again. The breakfast was o.k. Lots of muffins, danishes and cereals. There was a big line up for the waffle maker. Lots of kids everywhere too. The had warnings in the room about not leaving things open because of possible break ins. They also warned about people putting pizza flyer's under the door and to stay away from them because its people making pizza in their garage without regulations. All these warnings aside it was a decent enough place. We stayed just one night (a Saturday). I've been in much worse.

Reviews.Title: “A little unsafe, but on the thrifty travelor budget”
Reviews.Author: Snappy_Travelor
Reviews.Content: Thifty - that's it - I stayed here for three days. The US Navy and Military does as well. Contential Breakfast is okay. Safety was a concern, someone reported a camera missing in the room. Outside Vendors were seen not only placing flyers under doors but I saw them try opening each door to see if the travelor had left theirs unlocked (this was reported to the office mgr.) If you stay there - if you go sightseeing - take everything with you so you are not unhappy when you return. Rooms are very basic, okay clean, I've been in better "thrifty" locations. Is close by to the Hotel Circle if you have business there, and a pool and jacuzzi - which the military crowd kept full.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: green_spark
Reviews.Content: After 2 nights at a more expensive hotel in a dark, cramped room, I booked 2 nights at this Comfort Inn and got a room with a lot more space for a lot less money, and free parking. The room was clean, but basic. Breakfast is provided, but heavy on the carbohydrates. The room had no fridge, no microwave, no DVD player in the t.v., and a very limited number of cable channels. If you want Internet access and don't have a wireless, you'll have to drive down the street to the Doubletree (a sister property) and pay for access - which I was not informed of ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Icky and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: slr_7
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel. We stayed here 25+ years ago when it was called "7-11". It is a bit run down and needs renovation. The rooms while clean and decently furnished but were very small. Bathroom was the smallest one I have ever stayed in. The breakfast area was very crowded, lacked adequate tables and poorly laid out. In general this is not a bad place if you were paying $60-$80 per night but we paid twice that amount and expected a lot more luxury. There are so many better properties for the same price or substantially less money. Motel Circle sits right on the I-8 freeway. It is very noisy. This is at best a two star hotel and definitely not a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: crwinter1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. I booked through an ad in the San Diego visitors guide. The clerk booked us here instead of the one on Del Rio. Customer service got us into one of their other properties for the next 3 nights that had a kids suite (two rooms with a french door in between). We were supposed to have a kids suite and this property only has kids rooms which is a queen bed right next to bunkbeds. The room was way too small to have both a queen and a bunkbed. We were very cramped. I would not recommend this for a family to stay in. Breakfast was fine. Self serve waffles, breads, cereals, fruit and drinks. We arrived just before it closed and did not have to wait at all. We moved the next night over to their other property at 2401 Hotel Circle. Not sure if I would stay there again. I wrote a review for that property as well. Go check it out.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites Hotel Circle / SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 2201 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
